name: Molly Bolton
bio: Molly Bolten is a musician, songwriter and audio engineer from Oakland, California. A musician since early childhood, she studied music composition and creative writing in college. Once described by a softboi on Tinder as a “neo-soul Fiona Apple,” her music invokes a wide variety of influences from Billie Holiday to Courtney Barnett. Expect to be pulled in and spit out by her songs, which are equal parts scathing and sweet. Molly also runs a multimedia web zine called QUARANZINE for art made during the pandemic; this keeps her somewhat sane.

charity.name: The Anti Police-Terror Project
bio: The Anti Police-Terror Project is a Black-led, multi-racial, intergenerational coalition that seeks to build a replicable and sustainable model to eradicate police terror in communities of color. They support families surviving police terror in their fight for justice, documenting police abuses and connecting impacted families and community members with resources, legal referrals, and opportunities for healing. APTP is based in Oakland, California but has national implications, and has already expanded with a Sacramento, California chapter.
